text: The Evansville and Crawfordsville Railroad Company was Evansville, Indiana's first railroad company. It was first chartered in 1853 by William D. Griswold, a lawyer in Terre Haute, Indiana. It was renamed Evansville and Terre Haute Railroad in 1877. ==External links== *History Category:Defunct Indiana railroads Category:Transportation in Evansville, Indiana Category:Predecessors of the Chicago and Eastern Illinois Railroad Category:Railway companies established in 1853 Category:Railway companies disestablished in 1877 Category:1853 establishments in Indiana
title: Evansville and Crawfordsville Railroad
